questions.question: Which hook is used to manage state in React functional components?
Write a JavaScript function that takes an array of numbers and returns the sum of all even numbers.
Explain the difference between props and state in React.
questions.correctAnswer: Props are read-only data passed from parent to child components, while state is mutable data managed within a component that can trigger re-renders when changed.

questions.question: Which HTTP status code indicates a successful POST request that created a new resource?
Write a SQL query to find all users who have made more than 5 orders in the last 30 days.
questions.correctAnswer:
SELECT u.* FROM users u
JOIN orders o ON u.id = o.user_id
WHERE o.created_at >= DATE_SUB(NOW(), INTERVAL 30 DAY)
GROUP BY u.id
HAVING COUNT(o.id) > 5;

questions.question: Describe the differences between REST and GraphQL APIs.
questions.correctAnswer: REST uses multiple endpoints with fixed data structures, while GraphQL uses a single endpoint where clients can request exactly the data they need. GraphQL provides better flexibility and reduces over-fetching, but REST is simpler and more cacheable.

questions.question: Describe your design process from user research to final prototype.
questions.correctAnswer: Discovery & Research → User Personas & Journey Mapping → Information Architecture → Wireframing → Visual Design → Prototyping → User Testing → Iteration

questions.question: What is the primary goal of user experience design?
How do you measure the success of a UX design?
questions.correctAnswer: User satisfaction metrics, task completion rates, error rates, time on task, conversion rates, user feedback, and achievement of business goals.

questions.question: Explain the difference between supervised and unsupervised learning.
questions.correctAnswer: Supervised learning uses labeled training data to learn patterns and make predictions, while unsupervised learning finds hidden patterns in unlabeled data without predefined outcomes.
